title: 13+ GB Download
body:
So I was taking a break from league thanks to hectic college life, but summer is incoming and I thought i would re-install league. The thing is, the client is downloading like 14GB when I remember in the legacy client it used to be like 5 or 6 GB. Whats going on? And worse, there is no way to pause the download as 14GB is way over my daily download limit of 5Gb (Damned isp ...).

Is this a UI bug or something?

replies.body: Just remembered that diablo 3 had a 15GB download, in-comparison league does not seem to require downloading as many files as diablo needs. At the very least the 15GB download needs to be compressed (7.5 or 8GB) or have a a pause feature.

So I had gone over 3 GB then it stopped. Can't it patch the game along the way as it downloads at least so that we dont have to download from scratch please.... I had to waste 18 GB plus tryna download and its still cancelling this is making me start  hating on league. Riot please fix this NOW!!!!
My download says 17 GBs which is really overwhelming, Do you think it'll stop half way at maybe 6 GBs? or shall I go through downloading 17 GBs in 26 hours? -.-

Over the years, League has been adding new features like new champions/skins/wards/etc. Naturally, the size of the installation has grown as well. That really sucks that your ISP caps your daily download limit, and like you said we don't have a way to pause that download yet. I know it's not really the best solution, but the most I could suggest right now is to maybe try downloading the game at a friends house/pc cafe or something similar =\ .
